Title: IAEA Board of Governors Elects New Chairperson for 2024-2025
Description: The IAEA Board of Governors elected Ambassador Philbert Abaka Johnson as the Chairperson of the IAEA’s Board of Governors for 2024–2025.

Title: IAEA’s General Conference 2024 - The Week in a Nutshell
Description: Nearly 3000 participants took part in the IAEA’s 68th General Conference in Vienna this week, with an additional 8700 people joining online. Watch the IAEA’s video news summary of the week.

Title: Week in Review: 68th General Conference
Description: The 68th annual IAEA General Conference is coming to a close, with final discussions around possible resolutions likely to last into the evening.

Title: IAEA Director General's Statement on the Announcement of an Agree...
Description: Statement on the announcement of an agreement between China and Japan by IAEA Director General, Rafael Mariano Grossi.

Title: New Members Elected to IAEA Board of Governors
Description: Eleven countries have been newly elected to serve on the 35-member IAEA Board of Governors for the 2024–2025 period. The election took place on Thursday, 19 September, at the plenary session of the 68th IAEA General Conference.

Title: New Members Elected to IAEA Board of Governors
Description: Eleven countries have been newly elected to serve on the 35-member IAEA Board of Governors for the 2024–2025 period. The election took place on Thursday, 19 September, at the plenary session of the 68th IAEA General Conference.

Title: 68th IAEA General Conference: Day 4 Highlights
Description: Eleven countries have been elected to serve on the new 35-member IAEA Board of Governors for the 2024–2025 period. A Senior Safety and Security Regulators Meeting also took place today.

Title: Update 250 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi this week informed the annual Member States gathering of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) about its expanding efforts to help prevent a nuclear accident during the military conflict in Ukraine, saying the IAEA had deployed more than 140 support and assistance missions to the country over the past two years.

Title: 68th IAEA General Conference: Day 3 Highlights
Description: The 2024 Scientific Forum: Atoms4Food: Better Agriculture for Better Life concluded today. A new Anchor Centre officially joined the Rays of Hope: Cancer Care for All initiative and Liberia and South Africa joined multiple multilateral treaties under IAEA auspices.

Title: Liberia Commits to the Safe and Secure Uses of Nuclear Technology...
Description: At the annual Treaty Event on the sidelines of the IAEA General Conference today, Liberia pledged its commitment to nuclear safety and security by depositing instruments expressing consent to be bound by six legal instruments adopted under IAEA auspices.

Title: 68th IAEA General Conference: Day 2 Highlights
Description: On day two of the IAEA's General Conference, the Scientific Forum on the theme of Atoms4Food – Better Agriculture for Better Life opened with a room packed full of delegates.

Title: IAEA Scientific Forum on Food Security Opens
Description: The IAEA Scientific Forum 2024, themed Atoms4Food: Better Agriculture for a Better Life, opened alongside the 68th IAEA General Conference, focusing on how nuclear technology can help tackle global food insecurity.

Title: Scientific Forum Video 2024: Atoms4Food – Better Agriculture for ...
Description: The Scientific Forum 2024 has just opened, with this video on the topic of how nuclear technology can transform agrifood systems, address food insecurity and help countries adapt to the challenges of climate change.

Title: 68th IAEA General Conference: Opening Day Highlights
Description: From welcoming the IAEA’s newest Member States to learning about all aspects of the IAEA’s work, find out what happened on the first day of the IAEA's 68th General Conference.

Title: IAEA Director General: 'This Agency is and will continue to be at...
Description: The Director General of the IAEA told delegates at the opening of the 68th General Conference today that 'nothing is impossible', despite the current challenges the world faces.

Title: IAEA General Conference Elects Korean Ambassador as Conference Pr...
Description: The Republic of Korea’s Permanent Representative has been elected as the President of the IAEA’s 68th General Conference.

Title: IAEA Outlook for Nuclear Power Increases for Fourth Straight Year...
Description: The IAEA has revised up its annual projections for the expansion of nuclear power for a fourth successive year. World nuclear capacity is now projected to increase by 2.5 times the current capacity by 2050, in the IAEA’s high case scenario, including a significant contribution from SMRs.

Title: Update 249 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: The nuclear safety and security situation in Ukraine remains fragile because of the armed conflict, with IAEA staff continuing to hear the sound of military activities close to some of the sites, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said today.

Title: IAEA Mission to Thailand Finds a Robust Framework for Nuclear Sec...
Description: The IAEA completed an advisory service mission to Thailand focused on assessing the country's nuclear security regime for nuclear and other radioactive material out of regulatory control.

Title: The Week Ahead: IAEA Hosts General Conference
Description: Representatives from the IAEA’s 178 Member States will convene from 16–20 September for the 68th IAEA General Conference at the Agency’s headquarters in Vienna, Austria.

Title: General Conference Events: IAEA Flagship Initiatives Building Mom...
Description: The IAEA is highlighting its flagship initiatives, addressing challenges like climate change, energy sustainability and public health, at its upcoming 68th General Conference, providing a platform to review progress, seek input from member countries and outline the way forward.

Title: Mongolia Takes Steps to Enhance Cancer Detection and Treatment Ca...
Description: Mongolia is steadily expanding the capacity of its workforce to detect and treat cancer earlier, according to a team of international experts appointed by the IAEA, the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC).

Title: Japan’s Fukushima Soil Recycling and Disposal Plan Meets Safety S...
Description: Japan's approach for recycling and disposing of soil and radioactive waste from decontamination activities after the 2011 Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station (FDNPS) accident as currently planned is consistent with IAEA Safety Standards, an International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)

Title: Director General Briefs Board on Role of IAEA Diplomacy in Ukrain...
Description: From the hard realities of war in Europe and preventing a nuclear accident, to bringing health, and food to the tables, in developing countries, your Agency, the IAEA, is continuing its work,' the IAEA Director General tells Board of Governors.
